decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to assemble the powerful UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the deck to cast expensive colorless threats such as Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, and Karn Liberated. The deck also features powerful control elements such as Oblivion Stone and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to clear the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck is designed to efficiently ramp into powerful threats while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

This deck aims to aggressively play Death's Shadow as a large threat by manipulating its own life total to enable its ability while disrupting opponents with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. It also utilizes cards like Temur Battle Rage and Stubborn Denial to protect and push through damage with Death's Shadow. The deck also includes cantrips like Mishra's Bauble and Thought Scour to dig through the deck for more threats and answers. Snapcaster Mage provides additional flexibility by allowing the player to reuse key spells from the graveyard.

The core strategy of this deck revolves around rapidly lowering your own life total using cards like Street Wraith and Fetch Lands in order to power up Death's Shadow, a large and efficient threat. This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial while also having the ability to quickly close out the game with powerful threats like Gurmag Angler and Temur Battle Rage. The deck's strength lies in its ability to apply pressure early and consistently while also disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this Aggro - Humans deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient creature-based strategy. By playing powerful Human creatures such as Champion of the Parish, Mantis Rider, and Thalia's Lieutenant, supported by disruptive cards like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and maintain a strong board presence. Cards like Aether Vial and Noble Hierarch help accelerate the deck's game plan, while lands like Cavern of Souls and Ancient Ziggurat ensure that the mana base is smooth and consistent.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping into powerful Eldrazi creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator. By utilizing Eldrazi Temple and the Urza lands for mana acceleration, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with large threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Warping Wail and Dismember to handle opposing threats, maintaining board control and applying pressure to win the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up and play powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also utilizes Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt the opponent's strategy by shutting down artifacts and tutoring up key pieces. Chalice of the Void is used to control the opponent's spells, while cards like Dismember and Warping Wail provide removal options. With the help of Expedition Map and the Urza lands, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence and win the game through aggressive plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with infect, which deals damage to players in the form of -1/-1 counters. The key strategy is to quickly pump up the infect creatures with spells like Groundswell, Might of Old Krosa, and Scale Up, enabling them to deal lethal poison damage to the opponent. The deck also includes protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Blossoming Defense to ensure the infect creatures can get through to the opponent without being removed. The mana base is built to support the fast and aggressive nature of the deck.

The primary goal of this deck is to maintain control over the game by using a combination of powerful planeswalkers, counterspells, and removal spells. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by countering key spells, removing threats from the board, and generating card advantage with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Narset, Parter of Veils. By efficiently handling threats and out-valuing the opponent, the deck seeks to stall the game until it can establish dominance and win through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on using low-cost Human creatures with abilities that synergize well together to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant to pump up the team, along with disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while presenting a fast and aggressive board presence. Aether Vial is used to cheat creatures into play at instant speed, while lands like Cavern of Souls and Ancient Ziggurat ensure that the mana base is smooth and efficient.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By ramping mana with Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple, the deck can cast threats like Matter Reshaper, Reality Smasher, and Thought-Knot Seer ahead of schedule. Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Ineffable provide additional utility and removal options, while Chalice of the Void disrupts the opponent's game plan. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to close out games quickly while maintaining control of the board.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the game through powerful artifacts and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Urza, Lord High Artificer and Emry, Lurker of the Loch, along with the artifact synergy provided by cards such as Mox Opal and Arcum's Astrolabe, the deck aims to generate mana advantage and card advantage. The inclusion of Karn, the Great Creator allows for additional disruption and flexibility in dealing with opposing threats. Overall, the strategy revolves around establishing board presence, disrupting the opponent's game plan, and ultimately winning through card advantage and powerful threats.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through the use of cards like Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail, while also presenting a fast clock with powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also utilizes Karn, the Great Creator to lock out opponent's artifacts and Ugin, the Ineffable to generate card advantage and token creatures. With a mix of disruptive elements and powerful threats, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently in a 1 vs 1 Modern format.

This deck focuses on quickly reducing your own life total to empower Death's Shadow, a key threat that grows stronger as you lose life. By using cards like Mishra's Bauble and Street Wraith to draw cards and Inquisition of Kozilek, Thoughtseize, and Stubborn Denial to disrupt your opponent's game plan, you can protect your powerful creatures and push for a fast victory. The deck also includes versatile removal spells to deal with opposing threats and ways to search for specific cards in your deck, maximizing your chances of success in each game.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Tron lands and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures ahead of schedule. It uses disruption elements like Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail to control the board while applying early pressure with Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. The deck also includes utility cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Ineffable to provide additional value and flexibility. Overall, the key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and disruption to secure a swift victory.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping into powerful Eldrazi creatures using the Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple. It also includes disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail to control the opponent's board. The deck can also generate card advantage with Thought-Knot Seer and Karn, the Great Creator, while applying pressure with Reality Smasher and other aggressive creatures. It can easily take over the game by overwhelming the opponent with its efficient threats and versatile answers.

This deck focuses on quickly generating mana with cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to cast multiple spells in a turn, leading to a powerful combo finish with cards like Grapeshot and Past in Flames. The deck includes a lot of card selection and draw spells to find the combo pieces efficiently. It aims to control the game early on with counterspells like Remand and disruption like Gifts Ungiven, before going off and dealing lethal damage in one explosive turn.

This deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Noble Hierarch and Eldrazi Temple, along with card selection from Ancient Stirrings and Once Upon a Time, the deck aims to consistently drop powerful threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer early in the game. With disruption from cards like Stubborn Denial and removal options like Dismember, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure on the board.

This deck focuses on utilizing Death's Shadow as a powerful threat to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. By using cards like Street Wraith and Mishra's Bauble to lower their own life total, Death's Shadow becomes a massive threat early in the game. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial to control the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Temur Battle Rage allows for explosive damage output with Death's Shadow. The deck aims to be aggressive and efficient in order to close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on quickly getting Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler onto the battlefield while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial. Utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Street Wraith to cycle through the deck, the goal is to control the board and deal massive damage with efficient spells like Fatal Push and Temur Battle Rage. The archetype thrives on a delicate balance of resource management and aggression, aiming to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The main strategy is to control the board and push for a quick, decisive victory.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and aggressive strategy focused on playing Human creatures. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on with cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant, supported by disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. Aether Vial is used to cheat creatures into play while cards like Reflector Mage provide additional tempo advantage. The mana base is optimized for casting Humans efficiently and consistently.
